revised_title: Tectonic Evolution of the Himalayas and Tibet: A Comprehensive Discussion
tldr: This article discusses the tectonic evolution of the Himalayas and Tibet, focusing on the debate surrounding the use of thrust tectonic models in exploring the geological structure of mountain belts. The authors argue that while these models have limitations, they can still provide valuable insights into the accommodation of plate convergence within the continental lithosphere, the evolution of main orogenic loads, and the interplay between horizontal and vertical movements that control the morphology of the Himalayan ranges.
